function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Bringing activities to open green spaces without proper planning may lead to increased risk of contagious disease spread.","Impact":"Potential increase in the transmission and spread of contagious diseases among the public.","Mitigation":"Implementing strict guidelines for hygiene, sanitation, and social distancing in open green spaces. Conducting regular health and safety assessments.","Technologies":"Smart monitoring systems for crowd management and contact tracing. Sanitation stations and waste management facilities.","People":"Public, activity organizers, local residents, and visitors to green spaces.","Owner":"Local governments, public health authorities, and activity organizers."},{"Description":"Failure to incorporate green areas into urban policy may lead to inadequate planning for disease mitigation and public health in urban environments.","Impact":"Increased vulnerability to the spread of contagious diseases in urban areas due to lack of green space integration.","Mitigation":"Incorporating green infrastructure considerations into urban policy and planning. Engaging green area managers and stakeholders in decision-making processes.","Technologies":"GIS mapping for green space integration. Data analytics for assessing health benefits of green infrastructure.","People":"Urban planners, policymakers, green area managers, and the general public in urban areas.","Owner":"Urban planning departments, public health agencies, and green area management organizations."},{"Description":"Lack of investment in green areas could result in inadequate maintenance and deterioration, leading to decreased public health benefits and potential disease transmission risks.","Impact":"Reduced access to green spaces and potential increase in health hazards due to deterioration of green infrastructure.","Mitigation":"Prioritizing investment in green areas for maintenance and enhancement. Implementing sustainable maintenance practices and monitoring systems.","Technologies":"IoT sensors for monitoring green infrastructure. Sustainable landscaping and irrigation systems.","People":"Local governments, green space managers, and the public reliant on urban green spaces.","Owner":"Local government authorities, environmental agencies, and green space management organizations."},{"Description":"Resistance to change in decision-making may limit the implementation of measures to enhance green area relevance and public health benefits.","Impact":"Inability to address the need for enhancing green areas and public health in urban environments, leading to continued vulnerability to disease spread.","Mitigation":"Organized engagement and mobilization of stakeholders to advocate for the inclusion of green areas in decision-making processes. Public awareness campaigns on the health benefits of green spaces.","Technologies":"Social media platforms for advocacy and awareness. Digital platforms for public participation in urban policy development.","People":"Stakeholders, community organizations, and the general public advocating for green area relevance.","Owner":"Community organizations, advocacy groups, and urban planning departments."}]}
